name: Cumin-Paprika Chicken with Chickpea Quinoa and Roasted Vegetables
description: Juicy spiced chicken thighs served over lemony chickpea quinoa with a tray of roasted onions, peppers, and zucchini. Mild, protein-forward, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F with a large sheet pan inside.
Rinse 1.5 cups quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve.
Measure 3 cups water for the quinoa.
Drain and rinse chickpeas; set aside 1.5 cups.
Cut onions, bell peppers, and zucchini into bite-size pieces.
Zest then juice the lemon; keep separately.
Pat dry chicken thigh fillets and trim excess fat.
cook_steps: Roast vegetables: In a bowl, toss onions, bell peppers, and zucchini with 1 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch of salt, and black pepper. Spread on the preheated sheet pan and roast 18–22 minutes, tossing once, until tender and lightly charred.
Season chicken: In a large bowl, combine 2 tbsp olive oil, minced garlic, ground cumin, paprika, lemon zest, 1/2 tsp salt, and a few grinds of black pepper. Add chicken and coat well.
Sear chicken: Heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Sear chicken 3–4 minutes per side until browned.

Finish chicken in oven: Transfer the skillet to the oven (or move chicken to the sheet pan edges) and roast 8–12 minutes more, until cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F). Rest 5 minutes, then slice.

Cook quinoa: While chicken cooks, bring 3 cups water and 1/2 tsp salt to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in rinsed quinoa, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 14–16 minutes until water is absorbed. Remove from heat, cover, and rest 5 minutes.
Finish quinoa: Fluff quinoa with a fork. Fold in chickpeas, 1 tbsp lemon juice, half the chopped parsley, a pinch of salt, and black pepper to taste. Warm over low heat 1–2 minutes if needed.
Plate: Spoon chickpea quinoa onto plates, top with sliced chicken, add roasted vegetables on the side, and finish with remaining parsley and extra lemon juice to taste.

Rinse 1.5 cups quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve.
Measure 3 cups water for the quinoa.
Drain and rinse chickpeas; set aside 1.5 cups.
Cut onions, bell peppers, and zucchini into bite-size pieces.
Zest then juice the lemon; keep separately.

Roast vegetables: In a bowl, toss onions, bell peppers, and zucchini with 1 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch of salt, and black pepper. Spread on the preheated sheet pan and roast 18–22 minutes, tossing once, until tender and lightly charred.
Season chicken: In a large bowl, combine 2 tbsp olive oil, minced garlic, ground cumin, paprika, lemon zest, 1/2 tsp salt, and a few grinds of black pepper. Add chicken and coat well.
Sear chicken: Heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Sear chicken 3–4 minutes per side until browned.

Finish chicken in oven: Transfer the skillet to the oven (or move chicken to the sheet pan edges) and roast 8–12 minutes more, until cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F). Rest 5 minutes, then slice.

Cook quinoa: While chicken cooks, bring 3 cups water and 1/2 tsp salt to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in rinsed quinoa, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 14–16 minutes until water is absorbed. Remove from heat, cover, and rest 5 minutes.
Finish quinoa: Fluff quinoa with a fork. Fold in chickpeas, 1 tbsp lemon juice, half the chopped parsley, a pinch of salt, and black pepper to taste. Warm over low heat 1–2 minutes if needed.
Plate: Spoon chickpea quinoa onto plates, top with sliced chicken, add roasted vegetables on the side, and finish with remaining parsley and extra lemon juice to taste.
